Description: Body sherd of Corinthian black-figured pottery oinochoe; exterior, from top: wide black band with bands in added white and red superimposed; black-figure animal procession of goat and bird to left (of goat, head missing; added red on back, belly and thigh; of goose, tips of wings and tail feathers missing; red on neck and wings); blobs, incised blobs and splinter rosettes (some with red) as filling ornament; below, part of black band.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 62-3, pl. 50, no. 222)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 219)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.221) (phase 3)
